channel.title: About on Aurélie Boisbunon
channel.description: Recent content in About on Aurélie Boisbunon

item.title: Course at Statlearn 2022
item.description: I’ll be giving a course on the L1-penalty at StatLearn’s spring school, which will be held from 4 to 8 April in Cargèse, France.

item.title: Semi-supervised work presented at LION
item.description: Mikhail Kamalov presented “Graph diffusion & PCA framework for semi-supervised learning” at the Learning and Intelligent OptimizatioN (LION) conference last week.

item.title: Paper accepted to EUSIPCO
item.description: Our paper “PaZoe: classifying time series with few labels” just got accepted to EUSIPCO!

item.title: POT JMLR
item.description: Our paper “POT: Python Optimal Transport” was accepted to the Journal of Machine Learning Research (JMLR).

item.title: Paper accepted to GECCO
item.description: Our paper “Zoetrope Genetic programming” just got accepted to the Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference (GECCO).

item.title: Publications
item.description: You can find here the articles, reports and presentation supports I have done so far (’-FR’ means the document is in french), or visit my Scholar page.

item.title: Software
item.description: You can find here a few Matlab and Python programs.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: 2022 Practical applications of the L1 penalty (Doctoral course) Statlearn spring school 2022.
